entry.title: Kohoutek (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kohoutek (pictured) was the first comet to be proven a dirty snowball?

entry.title: Franklin Flores (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to one sociologist, Franklin Flores's landslide victory demonstrated his party's ability to win the rural vote "regardless of the candidates nominated"?

entry.title: use deadnames in bylines (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Northwest High School required transgender staff members of the student newspaper to use deadnames in bylines?

entry.title: Drummie Zeb (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Drummie Zeb was one of the last two original members of Aswad still playing with the reggae group by 2006?

entry.title: Lake Erie watersnake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that following the introduction of the round goby to Lake Erie, the Lake Erie watersnake's population recovered enough to be removed from the U.S. threatened species list?

entry.title: 1919 Copa del Rey Final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the lead-up to the 1919 Copa del Rey Final between FC Barcelona and Arenas Club de Getxo, fans broke the fencing twice to watch the sold-out match?

entry.title: Armstead Otey Grubb (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that former Lincoln University president Armstead Otey Grubb was robbed and murdered outside his home on campus in 1968?

entry.title: Spannungen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that concerts of the Spannungen festival of chamber music, founded by pianist Lars Vogt in 1998, are played in a power plant?
